channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tropical Storm Debby Is Expected to Bring Historic Rain to the Southeast
item.description: The National Weather Service has issued strong warnings for Georgia and South Carolina.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: U.S. Troops in Iraq Are Wounded in Rocket Attack on Air Base
item.description: Tensions have risen sharply in the region, with Israel and its allies bracing for retaliation after the killings last week of Hamas and Hezbollah leaders.

item.title: It’s not the Fed’s job to make the stock market ‘comfortable’ says Fed president
item.description: Analysts holding out for the Fed to rescue the stock market might be waiting in vain

item.title: The Tiny Chinese Restaurant That Became an Olympic Hot Spot
item.description: A few blocks from the table tennis venue, a restaurant has become an unofficial (and unlikely) clubhouse for fans, team officials and athletes.

item.title: The Tiny Chinese Restaurant That Became an Olympic Hot Spot
item.description: A few blocks from the table tennis venue, a restaurant has become an unofficial (and unlikely) clubhouse for fans, team officials and athletes.

item.title: 4 die and over 1,600 flights cancelled after Tropical Storm Debby slams Florida
item.description: Debby made landfall along the Gulf Coast of Florida early Monday as a Category 1 hurricane. It since has weakened to a tropical storm and is moving slowly.

item.title: Historically Black Medical Schools Land a $600 Million Donation
item.description: Bloomberg Philanthropies gives what are thought to be record-breaking gifts to the endowments of Meharry Medical College, Morehouse and Howard University.

item.title: Waiting for a Wider War, Lebanese Civilians Feel Helpless
item.description: Hezbollah’s conflict with Israel has already damaged south Lebanon. Now it could escalate, regardless of what anyone else in Lebanon thinks.

item.title: Pope Francis reveals his summer reading list and love for tragedies as he encourages young priests to read a ‘good’ book
item.description: In his letter the Pope made references to literary greats like C.S. Lewis, Marcel Proust, T. S. Eliot and fellow Argentinian Jorge Luis Borges.

item.title: Markets Begin to Rebound, and Harris V.P. Pick Expected Today
item.description: Plus, controversy in women’s Olympic boxing.

item.title: U.S. Troops in Iraq Are Wounded in Rocket Attack on Air Base
item.description: The attack late Monday resembled previous ones carried out by Iraqi armed groups, backed by Iran, which have targeted the base repeatedly over the past nine months.

item.title: Olympic boxer Imane Khelif hailed a ‘heroine’ by her home village despite gender row
item.description: Imane has found herself in the middle of a heated global row after it emerged that she had previously failed unspecified gender eligibility tests.

item.title: World’s Five Leading Chipmakers Have Now Promised U.S. Investment
item.description: The announcement of CHIPS Act funding for a plant in Indiana means the United States will have attracted investment from the world’s top chipmakers.

item.title: Long Battle for a Ruined City Takes a Desperate Turn
item.description: Ukrainian troops are engaged in a harsh struggle for Toretsk, a strategic city in eastern Ukraine that has been under relentless assault by Russian forces.

item.title: IBM’s former head of AI says Big Tech needs to end arms race in LLMs to ditch its carbon backpack
item.description: Seth Dobrin favors energy-efficient small language models and calls for a new ‘paradigm of cooling’ to solve AI's growing sustainability dilemma.
